source.1e0547cb:
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
source.dabc7ebf:
topyearairports = df[df.Rank == 1]
fig = px.bar(topyearairports,x = 'Country',y = 'Passengers',template='plotly_dark',color ='Country',text = 'Year',title = 'Most Crowded Countries Airports',color_discrete_sequence=['#B2B','#BF7'])
fig.update_traces(texttemplate = '%{text:.0f}',textposition='inside',marker_line=dict(width=1, color='#FFFFFF'))
source.a24ea5a8:
leastyearairports = df[df.Rank == 50]
fig = px.bar(leastyearairports,x = 'Country',y = 'Passengers',template='plotly_dark',color ='Country',text = 'Year',title = 'Least Crowded Countries Airports' )
fig.update_traces(texttemplate = '%{text:.0f}',textposition='inside',marker_line=dict(width=1, color='#FFFFFF'))
source.1e8c7aac:
years = [2016,2017,2018,2019,2020]
for i in years:
    year = df[df.Year == i]
    labels =[i[1] for i in  year['Airport'].head().apply(lambda x : x.split('\xa0'))]
    values = year.Passengers.head()

    fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Pie(labels=labels, values=values, textinfo='label+percent',
                                 insidetextorientation='radial',pull=[0.1, 0, 0, 0,0])])
    fig.update_layout(title= f'Top 5 Airports in {i} with Passengers Distribution')
    fig.show()
source.d185d4c8:
years = [2016,2017,2018,2019,2020]
for i in years:
    year = df[df.Year == i]
    labels =[i[1] for i in  year['Airport'].tail().apply(lambda x : x.split('\xa0'))]
    values = year.Passengers.tail()

    fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Pie(labels=labels, values=values, textinfo='label+percent',
                                 insidetextorientation='radial',pull=[0.1, 0, 0, 0,0])])
    fig.update_layout(title= f'Bottom 5 Airports in {i} with Passengers Distribution')
    fig.show()
source.d56f7232:
yp = df.groupby('Year')['Passengers'].sum()
fig = px.scatter(x =  [i for i in yp.index], y =[i for i in yp],color = [i for i in yp],size=[30,30,30,30,30],template='plotly_dark',opacity=0.9)
fig.update_layout(title = 'Years & Crowdedness Relationship')
source.da1e7f13:
fig = px.bar(mostcrowded,x = mostcrowded.index,y = mostcrowded,color = mostcrowded.index,template='plotly_dark',title = 'Most Crowded Airports-Countries')
fig.update_layout(xaxis_title = 'Countries',yaxis_title = 'Passengers Count in Billions')
source.4b169e43:
***From the above two graphs, United States Airport was the most crowded Airport since 2016 till 2019.***

***Maybe Because of the increasing impact of the pandemic, In 2020 Some of the United States Airports Came out to be the least crowded Airport, and China's Airport surpassed every other countries airport to be the Most Crowded Airport in 2020.***
